name: sbcex
params: setvar s0, class c0, wff w0

stmt.origin: sylbi(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c0, cab(s0, w0)))
stmt.pretty: sylbi([c0 / s0]w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ { s0 | w0 })

body.origin:
|- wi(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wcel(c0, universe))
-| wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wcel(c0, cab(s0, w0)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cab(s0, w0)), wcel(c0, universe))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wcel(c0, universe))
-| wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wcel(c0, cab(s0, w0)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cab(s0, w0)), wcel(c0, universe))

body.origin: |- wb(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wcel(c0, cab(s0, w0)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wsbc(s0, c0, w0), wcel(c0, universe))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cab(s0, w0)), wcel(c0, universe))

comment: By our definition of proper substitution, it can only be true if the substituted expression is a set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Oct-2016.)
